Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and describe two different habitats, one on land and one in water, in their drawing.
The student can include different kinds of plants in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, or flowering plants.
The student can include different kinds of animals in each habitat, like lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can show details that make each habitat unique and distinct from the other.
The student can illustrate patterns of plant and animal diversity by showing a variety of living things in each habitat.
